lines.content: * Represents a command that is parsed from user input.
* A CommandType enum that represents the type of command.
* The user input string. Currently a misnomer as it is the full user input.
* Value that defines whether the program should exit.
* Initialized to false until an exit command is entered.
LIST, EXIT, HELP, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE,
* Instantiates Command object with a CommandType enum only.
* Instantiates Command object with a CommandType enum and processedInput.
* @param processedInput the full user input string
* Executes instructions based on the received command and prints relevant messages to the UI.
* @param ui the UI to print to
* Gets the boolean value of exit.
* Represents a Deadline object as a Task.
* The date of the deadline in String type, used for writing to file.
* Instantiates a Deadline object with a description and a date.
* @param description the description of the deadline task
* @param date the date of the deadline in the format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm"
* @throws ParseException thrown when the format of date from user input is not recognized
public Deadline(String description, String date) throws ParseException {
* Overwrites the Task method toString to print a Deadline object with "[D]" followed by Task object followed by date.
* @return String of type of task, statusIcon, description and date
* Adds a deadline to the task list.
* Prints a message when the date or description is missing or invalid.
* @param input the user input string containing "deadline" followed by a description of the deadline followed by "/by" and the date
System.out.println("Specify a date or time using the keyword /by.");
System.out.println("Uh, the description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("Date and time format is invalid. (valid: dd/MM/yyyy HHmm)");
System.out.println("Specify a date or time after the keyword /by.");
* Instantiates Duke. Loads task list from file.
* Prints a message if unsuccessful in loading task list.
ui.getErrorMessage("There was an error in loading the file.\n", e);
* Describes the run cycle of the Duke Program.
* Prints a welcome message, then receives user input and executes instructions based on the input
* continuously until the user input executes the exit command.
* Upon exiting, writes or overwrites the current task list to a .txt file.
ui.getErrorMessage("File may not be saved properly.\n", e);
* Defines a special exception for this program.
* Represents an Event object as a Task.
* The date of the event in String type, used for writing to file.
* Instantiates an Event object, with a description and date.
* @param description the description of the event
* @param date the date of the event in the format "dd/MM/yyyy HHmm"
* @throws ParseException thrown when the format of date from user input is not recognized
public Event(String description, String date) throws ParseException {
* Overwrites the Task method toString to print an Event object with "[E]" followed by Task object followed by date.
* @return String of type of task, statusIcon, description and date
* Adds an event to the task list.
* Prints a message when the date or description is missing or invalid.
* @param input the user input string containing "event" followed by a description of the event followed by "/at" and the date
System.out.println("Specify a date or time using the keyword /at.");
System.out.println("Uh, the description of an event cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("Date and time format is invalid. (valid: dd/MM/yyyy HHmm)");
System.out.println("Specify a date or time after the keyword /at.");
* Represents a parser that interprets user input into commands.
* Interprets user input to return a command to execute.
* @param fullCommand the full user string input
* @return Command object corresponding to user input
* Handles reading and writing to hard disk.
* Writes the Task ArrayList to a .txt file in a fixed relative path.
* If a .txt file with the same name exists, deletes the old file and creates a new file to write to.
* @throws IOException thrown when the I/O operation has failed or is interrupted
* @throws NullPointerException thrown when attempting to access a null File object
public static void writeListToFile() throws IOException, NullPointerException{
f.mkdir(); // create directory if it doesn't exist
* Reads line by line from a .txt file in a fixed relative path to load an ArrayList of Task objects.
* If the .txt file does not exist, creates a new empty .txt file in that path.
* When an exception is thrown, the method terminates.
* @throws ParseException thrown when there is an error in parsing the file when constructing Task objects
* @throws DukeException thrown when the method does not recognize the data in the file
public static void readListFromFile() throws ParseException, DukeException {
* Represents a Task object, with a description of the task and its completion status.
* The description of a task given by the user.
* Value that marks whether the task is completed.
// public static ArrayList<Task> itemList = new ArrayList<Task>(100);
* Instantiates a Task object with the description of the task and marking isDone as false.
* @param description the description of a task given by the user
* Returns a check mark or a cross based on the value of isDone.
* @return check mark if isDone is true, cross if isDone is false
* Overrides the Object method toString to print a Task object with statusIcon followed by description.
* Assigns the isDone variable to true.
* Prints a confirmation message of the task being added to the list.
* Also prints how many tasks are in the list.
System.out.println("Got it, I've added this task:\n   " + TaskList.itemList.get(TaskList.itemList.size() - 1)
+ "\nNow you have " + TaskList.itemList.size() + " task(s) in the list.");
* Represents a static list of Task objects with methods to read from or modify the list.
* An empty static ArrayList of Task objects initialized to a capacity of 100.
public static ArrayList<Task> itemList = new ArrayList<Task>(100);
* Finds the task item in the task list itemList based on user input's number and marks that task as done, then prints a confirmation message.
* Prints an error message if the number does not correspond to items in the list or input is not a number.
* If the task has already been marked as done, prints a message.
* @param input The user input string, "done" followed by a number corresponding to am item in task list.
System.out.println("There's no task on the list corresponding to that number.");
System.out.println("You've already marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("Great, I've marked this task as done:\n    " + itemList.get(listIdx) +
"\nNow you have " + itemList.size() + " task(s) in the list.");
System.out.println("Specify the number corresponding to the task on the list.\n");
* Deletes the task in the task list itemList corresponding to the number in user input.
* Prints a confirmation message of the deletion of the Task from the list.
* Prints an error message if the number does not correspond to items in the list or input is not a number.
* @param input The user input string, "delete" followed by a number corresponding to an item in task list.
System.out.println("There's no task on the list corresponding to that number.");
System.out.println("Noted, I've removed this task:\n    " + itemList.get(listIdx) +
"\nNow you have " + (itemList.size()-1) + " task(s) in the list.");
System.out.println("Specify the number corresponding to the task on the list.\n" + e.getMessage());
* Finds Task objects that contain the keyword in user input from the task list itemList.
* Prints the Task objects whose description contains the keyword in user input.
* Prints a message when itemList does not contain any tasks.
* @param input the user input string "find" followed by keyword(s) to find
System.out.println("You have no tasks in your list.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Parses the line that is read from a .txt file, constructs a Task object based on the line and adds that Task to itemList.
* @param line the line read from file to be parsed, in the format T|s|description or C|s|description>date
*             where C is letter corresponding to type of Task and s representing the completion status (y/n)
* @throws ParseException thrown when there is an error in parsing the file when constructing Task objects
* @throws DukeException thrown when the method does not recognize the format of the line
public static void addFromFile(String line) throws ParseException, DukeException{
* Represents a ToDo object as a Task.
* Instantiates a ToDo object with a description of the todo.
* The method to instantiate this object is the same as its superclass Task.
* Overwrites the Task method toString to print a ToDo object with "[T]" followed by Task object.
* @return String of type of task, statusIcon and description
* Adds an event to the task list.
* Prints an error message when the description is missing.
* @param input the user input string containing "todo" followed by a description of the todo
System.out.println("Uh, the description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Handles most of the UI, including reading user inputs and printing some messages.
* Scanner object to read in user commands.
private static Scanner inp = new Scanner(System.in);
* Prints to terminal a welcome message.

System.out.println(line + "
Hello, I'm Duke!
What can I do for you?
" + line);
* Prints an error message saying the file data may be corrupted.
System.out.println("Something went wrong when loading the file. File data may be corrupted.");
* @param added additional information on the behaviour of the program when the exception is thrown
* @param e the message of the exception thrown
public void getErrorMessage(String added, Exception e) {
* Prints an error message when the user input is not recognised.
System.out.println("Uh, dunno what that means. Type \"help\" for the list of commands available.");
System.out.println("Here are the currently available commands:\n" +
"    1. todo [field]                 -- Add a todo task to the list\n" +
"    2. deadline [field] /by [time]  -- Add a deadline task to the list\n" +
"    3. event [field] /at [time]     -- Add an event to the list\n" +
"    4. done [number]                -- Mark corresponding task on the list as completed\n" +
"    5. delete [number]              -- Delete corresponding task on the list\n" +
* Prints all items in the current task list.
System.out.println("You have no tasks in your list.");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Simple test to check integration of JUnit.
* Test to check if the fields of a ToDo object in a list are instantiated correctly
ToDo.addToDo("       Finish JUnit tests     "); // extra spaces to check trim() method
